abstract: Walt Disney, concluding an internal investigation, cleared Steven P. Jobs on Friday of any misconduct in issuing backdated stock options at Pixar, the computer animation studio that Disney bought last year. A brief statement by John E. Pepper Jr., Disney’s chairman, did not mention Mr. Jobs by name. But the statement said that “while options were backdated at Pixar prior to the acquisition, no one currently associated” with Disney was involved in “any intentional or deliberate acts of misconduct.”
lead_paragraph: Walt Disney, concluding an internal investigation, cleared Steven P. Jobs on Friday of any misconduct in issuing backdated stock options at Pixar, the computer animation studio that Disney bought last year. A brief statement by John E. Pepper Jr., Disney’s chairman, did not mention Mr. Jobs by name. But the statement said that “while options were backdated at Pixar prior to the acquisition, no one currently associated” with Disney was involved in “any intentional or deliberate acts of misconduct.”

headline.main: Disney Clears Jobs of Options Misconduct at Pixar
